stitch guide bor beginning of round m1l decrease decrease with your left-hand needle pick up the bar between dpns double pointed needles the last stitch you knit and the next stitch on the left- ds double stitch see german short row hand needle bringing the needle from the front to the increase increase back knit into the back of the stitch you just picked up k k knit 1 st increased kds knit double stitch see german short row m marker m1r m1l make one left with your left-hand needle pick up the bar between m1r make one right the last stitch you knit and the next stitch on the left- p p purl hand needle bringing the needle from the back to the front then knit into the front of the stitch you just pds purl double stitch see german short row pm place marker picked up 1 st increased psso pass slipped stitch over repeat repeat 1x1 rib in the round round s round s round 1 *k1 p1 repeat from * to end of round rs right side repeat round 1 for pattern sl slip sm slip marker st s stitch es ws wrong side special techniques german short row yo yarnover on a rs row knit the number of stitches as stated in the pattern turn work bring yarn to front slip the first stitch as if to purl bring yarn over the needle to tools the back of your work and pull tight this creates the stitch markers qty 9 including 1 unique marker for double stitch = ds your bor scrap yarn or stitch holders optional on a ws row purl the number of stitches as stated tapestry needle in the pattern turn work bring yarn to front slip the first stitch as if to purl bring yarn over the needle to the back of your work and pull tight this creates the double stitch = ds resolving double stitches when working over dou- ble stitches treat them as a single stitch by knitting through both legs of the ds on a rs row kds or purl- ing through both legs of the ds on a ws row pds additional info difficulty level beginner bor marker is at the center of your back this can easily be knit in 1 or 2 colors if knitting in 1 color knit per instructions and disregard notes to cut yarn and join new colors yarn requirements by yardage c1 558 617 668 744 814 855 949 1023 1156 1243 1294 yd yarn requirements by meter c1 510 564 611 680 744 782 867 935 1057 1136 1183 m to knit in 2 colors where instructions call out c1 and c3 these would be knit in one color and c2 would be in a constrasting color
